class.name: Script
class.brief_description: A class stored as a resource.
class.description: A class stored as a resource. A script extends the functionality of all objects that instantiate it. This is the base class for all scripts and should not be used directly. Trying to create a new script with this class will result in an error. The [code]new[/code] method of a script subclass creates a new instance. [method Object.set_script] extends an existing object, if that object's class matches one of the script's base classes.

method.name: can_instantiate
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the script can be instantiated.

method.name: get_base_script
method.description: Returns the script directly inherited by this script.

method.name: get_global_name
method.description:
Returns the class name associated with the script, if there is one. Returns an empty string otherwise. To give the script a global name, you can use the [code]class_name[/code] keyword in GDScript and the [code][GlobalClass][/code] attribute in C#. [codeblocks] [gdscript] class_name MyNode extends Node [/gdscript] [csharp] using Godot;
[GlobalClass] public partial class MyNode : Node { } [/csharp] [/codeblocks]

method.name: get_property_default_value
method.description: Returns the default value of the specified property.

method.name: get_rpc_config
method.description: Returns a [Dictionary] mapping method names to their RPC configuration defined by this script.

method.name: get_script_constant_map
method.description: Returns a dictionary containing constant names and their values.

method.name: get_script_method_list
method.description: Returns the list of methods in this [Script]. [b]Note:[/b] The dictionaries returned by this method are formatted identically to those returned by [method Object.get_method_list].

method.name: get_script_property_list
method.description: Returns the list of properties in this [Script]. [b]Note:[/b] The dictionaries returned by this method are formatted identically to those returned by [method Object.get_property_list].

method.name: get_script_signal_list
method.description: Returns the list of signals defined in this [Script]. [b]Note:[/b] The dictionaries returned by this method are formatted identically to those returned by [method Object.get_signal_list].

method.name: has_script_signal
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the script, or a base class, defines a signal with the given name.

method.name: has_source_code
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the script contains non-empty source code. [b]Note:[/b] If a script does not have source code, this does not mean that it is invalid or unusable. For example, a [GDScript] that was exported with binary tokenization has no source code, but still behaves as expected and could be instantiated. This can be checked with [method can_instantiate].

method.name: instance_has
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if [param base_object] is an instance of this script.

method.name: is_abstract
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the script is an abstract script. An abstract script does not have a constructor and cannot be instantiated.

method.name: is_tool
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the script is a tool script. A tool script can run in the editor.

method.name: reload
method.description: Reloads the script's class implementation. Returns an error code.

members.member: The script source code or an empty string if source code is not available. When set, does not reload the class implementation automatically.
